title: What is ancient and modern criticism on Plato’s philosophy? - Quora

response.answer_text: ‘Ancient’ criticism is largely somewhat flattering to Plato who bears an unholy ‘holiness’ in some modern circles. Even in ‘ancient’ times he was criticised roundly by the pre-Socratics. And criticised even more roundly by modern critics of his ‘religioso’ appreach thereby emphasising ‘thinking’, arguably a deadly line to adopt for who’s going to criticise their own thinking? History has shown Plato’s influence to be severe and damaging. I have detected some unscholarly reverence to both Socrates and Plato (perhaps less to Aristotle) conferring on them some divine protection from criticism.

In the mid 20th century, Karl Popper called Plato’s Republic the original charter of fascism. The first volume of his two volume work, THE OPEN SOCIETY AND ITS ENEMIES is chiefly devoted to demolishing Plato as grandfather of those “enemies” of open society/ Interestingly, George Soros has in our own time picked up on Popper’s terminology.
